title: Chocolate Lava Cake with Raspberry Coulis
shortDescription: Indulge in the rich, gooey center of these decadent chocolate lava cakes, complemented by a tangy raspberry coulis.

instructions.instruction: Preheat your oven to 200°C (392°F). Grease four ramekins with butter and dust with cocoa powder.
In a heatproof bowl, melt 200 grams of high-quality dark chocolate and 150 grams of unsalted butter over a double boiler. Stir until smooth.
In a separate bowl, whisk together 3 large eggs, 3 egg yolks, and 100 grams of granulated sugar until well combined.
Gently fold the melted chocolate mixture into the egg mixture until just combined.
Finally, sift in 50 grams of all-purpose flour and fold until the batter is smooth.
Pour the batter evenly into the prepared ramekins.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are set but the center remains soft.
Remove from the oven and let the cakes cool for a minute before gently running a knife around the edges and inverting them onto serving plates.
In a blender, combine 150 grams of fresh raspberries and 2 tablespoons of powdered sugar. Blend until smooth.
Strain the mixture through a fine mesh sieve to remove seeds.
Chill the raspberry coulis in the refrigerator until ready to serve.
Place each chocolate lava cake on a serving plate.
Drizzle the tops with the raspberry coulis and garnish with fresh raspberries and a dusting of powdered sugar.
Serve immediately, and enjoy the heavenly combination of warm chocolate lava with the tartness of raspberry coulis.

body: Indulge in a taste of luxury with these Chocolate Lava Cakes. The exterior is perfectly baked, creating a delicate shell that gives way to a gooey, molten center. Paired with a luscious Raspberry Coulis, this dessert is a symphony of rich chocolate and vibrant fruit flavors. Treat yourself and your guests to a divine culinary experience!
